sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"形式"或"外形"之意。
means: form ： 最普通用词，含义广，既可指客观物体的外形，又可用于抽象概念的"形"。
figure ： 指轮廓、外形，尤指体态，相貌或身体。
shape ： 通常指由线和面所围成的外观上的形，侧重立体形状。
outline ： 指任何形状的轮廓线。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"名单，目录，表格"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: list, catalog(ue), rgeister, roll, schedule, table, chart, form
means: list ： 最普通用词，含义广。指按字母顺序、时间先后或类别等排列的姓名或项目等的单子。
catalog(ue) ： 指列出有全部队名、物名或项目等的目录，有时附有简要说明的分类名单或一览表。
rgeister ： 多指官方对人或事作出的正式书面记录或详细清单。
roll ： 多指人员的姓名名单，尤指属于团体或军事单位的全体人员名单。
schedule ： 既可指时间或计划的安排表，又可指详细列出的所有分类项的清单或细表。
table ： 普通用词，一般指易于迅速查阅使用，具有特定编排方法的目录或表格。
chart ： 指把资料制成表格等形式供人看的图表。
form ： 指上面印有横线或格让人填写规定内容的表格。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"使成形"之意。
means: mould ： 通常指把有延展性的材料浇铸或塑成所需形状的物品。
forge ： 意义较窄，指用锤子和砧对金属材料进行加工或锻造。
form ： 通常指对尚未成形的物品作进一步加工，使成为成品。
shape比mould使用广泛，指用许多不同的方法制成不同形状的制品。

word_mean: 形状，形态：通常由形状和大小或其他外形决定的结构或物体特征

sentence.Network_en: Swimming is probably the best form of exercise you can get.
sentence.Network_cn: 游泳或许是现有的最佳锻炼方式。

方式;做法

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French forme (noun), fo(u)rmer (verb, from Latin formare 'to form'), both based on Latin forma 'a mould or form'

entry.def: A form of something is a type or kind of it.

example.ex: He contracted a rare form of cancer...
example.tran: 他得了一种罕见的癌症。

example.ex: Doctors are willing to take some form of industrial action...
example.tran: 医生们愿意采取某种形式的劳工行动。

entry.def: When something can exist or happen in several possible ways, you can use form to refer to one particular way in which it exists or happens.

example.ex: Valleys often take the form of deep canyons...
example.tran: 山谷经常以深峡谷的形态存在。

example.ex: They received a benefit in the form of a tax reduction...
example.tran: 他们获得了减税优惠。

entry.tran: 形成;(使)排列成;组成…形状
entry.def: When a particular shape forms or is formed, people or things move or are arranged so that this shape is made.

example.ex: A queue forms outside Peter's study...
example.tran: 彼得书房外面排起了队。

example.ex: They formed a circle and sang 'Auld Lang Syne'...
example.tran: 他们围成一个圆圈，唱起了《友谊地久天长》。

entry.def: The form of something is its shape.

example.ex: ...the form of the body.
example.tran: 体形

entry.def: You can refer to something that you can see as a form if you cannot see it clearly, or if its outline is the clearest or most striking aspect of it.

example.ex: She thought she'd never been so glad to see his bulky form.
example.tran: 她想她从来没有因看到他那肥胖的身躯而如此高兴。

entry.def: If something is arranged or changed so that it becomes similar to a thing with a particular structure or function, you can say that it forms that thing.

example.ex: These panels folded up to form a screen some five feet tall...
example.tran: 这些嵌板折起来组成了一个约 5 英尺高的屏风。

example.ex: All the buildings have names and form a half circle.
example.tran: 所有的建筑都有名称，连在一起构成了一个半圆。

entry.def: If something consists of particular things, people, or features, you can say that they form that thing.

example.ex: ...the articles that formed the basis of Randolph's book...
example.tran: 构成伦道夫此书的基础的那些文章

example.ex: Cereals form the staple diet of an enormous number of people around the world.
example.tran: 谷类是世界范围内很大一部分人的主要食物。

entry.def: If you form an organization, group, or company, you start it.

example.ex: They tried to form a study group on human rights...
example.tran: 他们试图组建一个人权问题研究小组。

example.ex: They formed themselves into teams.
example.tran: 他们组成了几个队。

entry.def: When something natural forms or is formed, it begins to exist and develop.

example.ex: The stars must have formed 10 to 15 billion years ago...
example.tran: 这些恒星一定是形成于 100 到 150 亿年前。

example.ex: Huge ice sheets were formed.
example.tran: 巨大的冰层形成了。

entry.tran: (使)(关系、习惯或想法)形成;(使)产生
entry.def: If you form a relationship, a habit, or an idea, or if it forms, it begins to exist and develop.

example.ex: This should help him form lasting relationships...
example.tran: 这应该能帮助他建立持久的关系。

example.ex: She had formed the habit of giving herself freely to men...
example.tran: 她已经养成了对男人投怀送抱的习惯。

entry.def: If you say that something forms a person's character or personality, you mean that it has a strong influence on them and causes them to develop in a particular way.

example.ex: Anger at injustice formed his character.
example.tran: 对不公正现象的愤怒塑造了他的性格。

entry.tran: (运动员或参赛动物的)竞技状态,表现状态
entry.def: In sport, form refers to the ability or success of a person or animal over a period of time.

example.ex: His form this season has been brilliant...
example.tran: 他这一赛季状态非常不错。

example.ex: Leconte showed good form.
example.tran: 勒孔特表现出良好的状态。

entry.def: A form is a paper with questions on it and spaces marked where you should write the answers. Forms usually ask you to give details about yourself, for example when you are applying for a job or joining an organization.

example.ex: You will be asked to fill in a form with details of your birth and occupation.
example.tran: 你将需要填写一张有关生日和职业详情的表格。

example.ex: ...application forms.
example.tran: 申请表

entry.tran: 讨厌的行为;不礼貌的行为
entry.def: If you say that it is bad form to behave in a particular way, you mean that it is rude and impolite.

example.ex: It was thought bad form to discuss business on social occasions.
example.tran: 在社交场合讨论生意被认为是不礼貌的。

entry.tran: 身体健康;情况良好;心情愉悦
entry.def: If you say that someone is in good form, you mean that they seem healthy and cheerful.
If you say that someone is off form, you think they are not performing as well as they usually do.

entry.tran: 状态良好;表现出色;发挥正常
entry.def: If you say that someone is on form, you think that they are performing their usual activity very well.

example.ex: Robert Redford is back on form in his new movie 'Sneakers'.
example.tran: 罗伯特·雷德福在新片《通天神偷》中恢复了表演水准。

entry.def: When something takes form, it develops or begins to be visible.

example.ex: As plans took form in her mind, she realized the need for an accomplice...
example.tran: 随着计划在脑海里逐渐成形，她意识到需要找一个帮手。

example.ex: The face of Mrs Lisbon took form in the dimness.
example.tran: 昏暗中，里斯本夫人的脸慢慢变得清晰起来。

entry.def: If someone or something behaves true to form, they do what is expected and is typical of them.

example.ex: Before the train had left the outskirts of London he behaved true to form and began a conversation...
example.tran: 一如往常，列车还没驶出伦敦郊区，他就开始和别人聊起天来。

example.ex: My luck was running true to form...
example.tran: 我的运气和往常一样。

means.word_mean: 1. the phonological or orthographic sound or appearance of a word that can be used to describe or identify something;

sentences.sentence: "the inflected forms of a word can be represented by a stem and a list of inflections to be attached"

means.word_mean: 2. a category of things distinguished by some common characteristic or quality;
3. a perceptual structure;

sentences.sentence: "the composition presents problems for students of musical form"
"a visual pattern must include not only objects but the spaces between them"

means.word_mean: 4. any spatial attributes (especially as defined by outline);

sentences.sentence: "he could barely make out their shapes through the smoke"

means.word_mean: 5. alternative names for the body of a human being;

sentences.sentence: "the spirit is willing but the flesh is weak"

means.word_mean: 6. the spatial arrangement of something as distinct from its substance;

sentences.sentence: "geometry is the mathematical science of shape"

means.word_mean: 7. the visual appearance of something or someone;
8. (physical chemistry) a distinct state of matter in a system; matter that is identical in chemical composition and physical state and separated from other material by the phase boundary;

sentences.sentence: "the reaction occurs in the liquid phase of the system"

means.word_mean: 9. a printed document with spaces in which to write;
10. (biology) a group of organisms within a species that differ in trivial ways from similar groups;
11. an arrangement of the elements in a composition or discourse;

sentences.sentence: "the essay was in the form of a dialogue"
"he first sketches the plot in outline form"

means.word_mean: 12. a particular mode in which something is manifested;

sentences.sentence: "his resentment took the form of extreme hostility"

means.word_mean: 13. a body of students who are taught together;
14. an ability to perform well;

sentences.sentence: "he was at the top of his form"
"the team was off form last night"

means.word_mean: 15. a life-size dummy used to display clothes
16. a mold for setting concrete;

sentences.sentence: "they built elaborate forms for pouring the foundation"

means.word_mean: 1. to compose or represent:"This wall forms the background of the stage setting";
2. create (as an entity);
3. develop into a distinctive entity;
4. give a shape or form to;
5. make something, usually for a specific function;
6. establish or impress firmly in the mind;

sentences.sentence: "We imprint our ideas onto our children"

means.word_mean: 7. give shape to;

auth_sentence.res_content: This is a mild form and rarely causes disability.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This is a mild form and rarely causes disability.

auth_sentence.content: The caramel will cool quickly and form thin strands.
auth_sentence.res_content: The caramel will cool quickly and form thin strands.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The caramel will cool quickly and form thin strands.

auth_sentence.content: Use this form to send in your wise words.
auth_sentence.res_content: Use this form to send in your wise words.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Use this form to send in your wise words.

Sentence.sentence: Hand in her roommate's application form.
Among the kinds of social gestures most significant for second-language teachers are those which are identical in form but different in meaning in the two cultures
Only Ford may survive in its current form.
It is a new form of verbal communication.
Driving form New York to Boston
They form a solid basis for policy making.

means.word_mean: 组成, 结构, 形式; 种类, 体制

sentences.en: Ice, snow and steam are different forms of water.
sentences.cn: 冰、雪、蒸汽是水的不同形式。

means.word_mean: 人[物]的形状, 样子

sentences.en: In the early morning we could just make out the dark forms of the mountains.
sentences.cn: 在晨曦中我们只能看见群山的黛色轮廓。

means.word_mean: 需填写的表格
音乐和文学作品的形式, 体裁
形成, 构成, 产生

sentences.cn: 水煮沸之后就形成蒸汽。

sentences.en: The idea formed in her mind.
sentences.cn: 这个想法在她头脑中形成了。

means.word_mean: 塑造, 养成; 培养，训练；教育

sentences.en: Children should form good habits from the very beginning.
sentences.cn: 孩子们从一开始就应养成良好的习惯。

means.word_mean: 组织, 成立

sentences.cn: 我们成立了一个俱乐部。

means.word_mean: 结成(友谊)；养成(习惯)

sentences.en: They had soon formed a firm friendship.
sentences.cn: 他们很快结成牢固的友谊。

means.word_mean: 【军事】编(队)，整(队)(常与into连用)

sentences.en: The soldiers formed themselves into lines.

means.word_mean: (事物、局面、思想等)形成，产生；建立

sentences.en: These ideas have been forming in my mind.
sentences.cn: 这些想法在我的头脑中已经形成。

means.word_mean: 排队，列队，整队；【军事】编成队形(常与into连用)

sentences.en: The soldiers formed into three lines.
sentences.cn: 这些士兵队列编成三行。

jushi.english: Ice, snow and steam are different forms of water.
jushi.chinese: 冰、雪、蒸汽是水的不同形式。

jushi.english: These are the finite forms of a verb.
jushi.chinese: 这些是一个动词的限定形式。

jushi.english: We artists should combine healthy political content with finished artistic forms.
jushi.chinese: 我们艺术家应该把健康的政治内容和完美的艺术形式结合起来。
